channel.title: Modules on GEO 109
channel.description: Recent content in Modules on GEO 109

item.title: 02 GPS
item.description: Presentation Open in new tab Week 04: How we used to do it 05: Modern GNSS Task In this task, you will try to find virtual geocaches using a GPS receiver app on your mobile device’s web browser. A virtual geocache is usually a distinct or interesting feature in the landscape, like a scenic spot or sculpture, that you can find using a GPS and hints. If you find this task enjoyable, Geocaching.

item.title: 03 GIS
item.description: Presentation Open in new tab Week 06: Introduction to GIS Task Maps are literally everywhere. From outdoor wayfinding to decoration, they are so common that we often don’t even notice them. In your first task for credit, you will explore the ubiquity of maps in our built environment and describe one. This is a popular past time amoung map nerds – just do a search on your favorite social media for the hashtag #mapsinthewild.

item.title: 01 Data
item.description: Presentation Open in new tab Week 02: Data 03: Creating your own Lab In this lab we will explore how to take observations and encode them into a data format that can be stored, shared, and mapped. We will discover that we can locate any place on the planet with two numbers – an elagant and powerful concept. We will then visualize this data in our primary mapping application, QGIS.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Presentation Open in new tab Week 01: Introduction and why you should be a Geography Major Tasks Welcome to GEO109! This week we will be getting to know each other and the course. Please complete the following tasks: Tell us a little about yourself in this private form. Only the instructors will see your responses. Push a pin for your hometown in this interactive map. (Note: the link goes to a different website – one of our online mapping program’s collaboration servers.
